{{title|1=operator==, operator&lt;=&gt;&lt;small&gt;(std::basic_stacktrace)&lt;/small&gt;}}
{{cpp/utility/basic_stacktrace/navbar}}
{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl|num=1|since=c++23|1=
template&lt; class Allocator2 &gt;
friend bool operator==( const basic_stacktrace&amp; lhs,
                        const basic_stacktrace&lt;Allocator2&gt;&amp; rhs ) noexcept;
}}
{{dcl|num=2|since=c++23|1=
template&lt; class Allocator2 &gt;
friend std::strong_ordering
    operator&lt;=&gt;( const basic_stacktrace&amp; lhs,
                 const basic_stacktrace&lt;Allocator2&gt;&amp; rhs ) noexcept;
}}
{{dcl end}}

@1@ Checks if the contents of {{c|lhs}} and {{c|rhs}} are equal, that is, they have the same number of elements and each element in {{c|lhs}} compares equal with the element in {{c|rhs}} at the same position.

@@ Equivalent to {{c|return std::equal(lhs.begin(), lhs.end(), rhs.begin(), rhs.end());}}.

@2@ Returns the relative order of the numbers of stacktrace entries in {{c|lhs}} and {{c|rhs}} if they are not equal. Otherwise (if the numbers of elements of {{c|lhs}} and {{c|rhs}} are equal), returns the lexicographical order of the elements of {{c|lhs}} and {{c|rhs}}.

@@ Equivalent to&lt;br&gt;{{c|1=if (auto cmp = lhs.size() &lt;=&gt; rhs.size(); cmp != 0)
    return cmp;
else
    return std::lexicographical_compare_three_way(lhs.begin(), lhs.end(),
                                                  rhs.begin(), rhs.end());}}.

{{cpp/hidden friend|std::basic_stacktrace&lt;Allocator&gt;|plural=yes|tmpl=yes}}

{{cpp/note synthesized compare}}

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|lhs, rhs|{{tt|basic_stacktrace}}s whose contents to compare}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
@1@ {{c|true}} if the contents of {{c|lhs}} and {{c|rhs}} are equal, {{c|false}} otherwise.

@2@ {{c|1=lhs.size() &lt;=&gt; rhs.size()}} if the result is not {{lc|std::strong_order::equal}}, the lexicographical order of the elements of {{c|lhs}} and {{c|rhs}} otherwise.

===Complexity===
@1,2@ Constant if {{c|lhs}} and {{c|rhs}} are of different size, linear in the size of {{c|lhs}} otherwise.
